doc.field: This box holds a set of folders that appear to be Spadafora's office files from circa 2003-04 when he was an Assistant Bureau Chief in the Bureau of Fire Prevention, though the files hold a few documents back to the 1990s. The files include a mix of technical topics, such as carbon monoxide, fire extinguishers, sprinklers, FDNY fire prevention reference guide (2001), etc. (with tearsheets, vendor product info, and other reference material); administrative matters, such as budgeting and revenue, attendance control, objectives, time use analyses; and specific FDNY fire prevention issues, such as fire safety plans for 171 West 85th Street and Pier 86, proposed rules on storage of compressed gas, and others. In a file on union District Council 37 is a copy of the union's laudatory comments about Spadafora, sent to Commissioner Scoppetta urging Spadafora be named to the vacant Chief position (March 2004). VHS from vendor Mobile Hi-Fog re: fire suppression equipment. Photos/snapshots of docked freighters (mostly), with an emphasis on one named "Independence" (2003). (Includes video format)
